citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Actinomycetospora straminea sp. nov.
Actinomycetospora straminea (stra.mi′ne.a. L. fem. adj. straminea made of straw, intended to mean straw-coloured).
The surface of the colonies is powdery.
The colour of the substrate mycelium is pale greenish yellow to yellow.
Spore chains are white and the spore surface is smooth.
The spore chains form loops or spirals.
The substrate mycelium is long, well-developed and branched.
Grows at 10–28 °C, pH 6.0–8.0 and NaCl concentrations up to 5 %.
d-Arabitol, l-arabitol, l-fucose, gluconate, 5-ketogluconate, d-glucose, d-lyxose, d-mannitol, sucrose, trehalose and turanose are utilized as sole carbon sources.

Positive for gelatin hydrolysis, nitrate reduction, acid phosphatase, cystine aminopeptidase, esterase (C-4), esterase lipase (C-8), α-glucosidase, leucine aminopeptidase, pyrazinamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase and valine aminopeptidase, but negative for aesculin and urea hydrolysis.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0 and iso-C16 : 1.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 74 mol%.
The type strain is IY07-55T ( = NBRC 105528T = KACC 14251T), which was isolated from paddy field soil on Iriomote Island, Okinawa, Japan.
